Body: Possible Duplicate:  Suggestions for syncing data to someone besides Google? Funambol?  The idea is to cut Google's (or other 3rd-party) proprietary bits out of an Android installation, while retaining the benefits of "cloud" computing.  For most things there are open-source alternatives: SK for keyboard, K-9 Mail for e-mail, etc.  However, for the core "cloud" services like Contacts and Calendar, all replacements that I've seen simply redirect you to their own closed and proprietary cloud servers.From a quick search around the web, the closest open-source alternative is Funambol's client/server solution.  I was wondering if anyone's had any luck setting up their own instance of a "personal cloud" of sorts using this or a similar package, and successfully using it to sync contacts data to an Android device.Bonus points if there is a package for use with a Synology NAS drive :)
Title: Is there a Google-less "personal cloud" for contacts, calendar, tasks and images sync?

history.Text: The idea is to cut Google's (or other 3rd-party) proprietary bits out of an Android installation, while retaining the benefits of "cloud" computing.  For most things there are open-source alternatives: [SK][1] for keyboard, [K-9 Mail][2] for e-mail, etc.  However, for the core "cloud" services like Contacts and Calendar, all replacements that I've seen simply redirect you to their own closed and proprietary cloud servers.From a quick search around the web, the closest open-source alternative is [Funambol][3]'s client/server solution.  I was wondering if anyone's had any luck setting up their own instance of a "personal cloud" of sorts using this or a similar package, and successfully using it to sync contacts data to an Android device.Bonus points if there is a package for use with a Synology NAS drive :)  [1]: http://code.google.com/p/softkeyboard/  [2]: http://code.google.com/p/k9mail/  [3]: http://funambol.com/
Is there a Google-less "personal cloud" for contacts, calendar, tasks and images sync?

> **Possible Duplicate:**  > [Suggestions for syncing data to someone besides Google? Funambol?](http://android.stackexchange.com/questions/7774/suggestions-for-syncing-data-to-someone-besides-google-funambol)  The idea is to cut Google's (or other 3rd-party) proprietary bits out of an Android installation, while retaining the benefits of "cloud" computing.  For most things there are open-source alternatives: [SK][1] for keyboard, [K-9 Mail][2] for e-mail, etc.  However, for the core "cloud" services like Contacts and Calendar, all replacements that I've seen simply redirect you to their own closed and proprietary cloud servers.From a quick search around the web, the closest open-source alternative is [Funambol][3]'s client/server solution.  I was wondering if anyone's had any luck setting up their own instance of a "personal cloud" of sorts using this or a similar package, and successfully using it to sync contacts data to an Android device.Bonus points if there is a package for use with a Synology NAS drive :)  [1]: http://code.google.com/p/softkeyboard/  [2]: http://code.google.com/p/k9mail/  [3]: http://funambol.com/
